```{r setup, include=FALSE}

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
	echo = TRUE,
```

```{r}
#| echo: false

library(plotly)

# Define o ano atual
current_year <- 2025

# Criação do data frame com os dados e na ordem desejada
df_energy <- data.frame(
  language  = c("Python", "R", "SQL", "Quarto", "LaTeX", "VBA", "DAX", "HTML5/CSS"),
  since     = c(2021, 2008, 2020, 2022, 2001, 2003, 2016, 2022),
  knowledge = c(7, 8, 7, 8, 8, 6, 5, 6)  # Escala de 1 a 10
)

# Reordena o fator de linguagem na ordem desejada
df_energy$language <- factor(
  df_energy$language,
  levels = c("Python", "R", "SQL", "Quarto", "LaTeX", "VBA", "DAX", "HTML5/CSS")
)

# Calcula quantos anos de uso para cada linguagem
df_energy$years_used <- current_year - df_energy$since + 1

# Calcula a "energia" como porcentagem (por exemplo, nível 7 = 70% de energia)
df_energy$energy <- (df_energy$knowledge / 10) * 100

# Cria um texto de hover customizado para cada barra
df_energy$hover_txt <- with(df_energy, paste0(
  "<b>", language, "</b><br>",
  "Years used: ", years_used, "<br>",
  "Expertise level: ", knowledge, "/10<br>",
  "Since: ", since, "<br>",
  "Energy: ", round(energy, 1), "%"
))

# Cria o gráfico de barras horizontais
fig_energy <- plot_ly(
  data = df_energy,
  x = ~energy,
  y = ~language,
  type = "bar",
  orientation = "h",
  text = ~paste0(round(energy), "%"),  # Mostra a porcentagem dentro da barra
  textposition = "inside",
  insidetextfont = list(color = "white", size = 16),
  hoverinfo = "text",
  hovertext = ~hover_txt,
  marker = list(
    color = "#58acd8",      # Azul claro (ajuste conforme desejar)
    line = list(
      width = 2,
      color = "#2c7eb6"     # Azul mais escuro, para a borda
    )
  )
) %>%
  layout(
    title = list(text = "Energy Levels and Expertise in Programming Languages", x = 0.5),
    xaxis = list(
      title = "Energy (%)",
      range = c(0, 100),
      showgrid = FALSE,
      zeroline = FALSE,
      showticklabels = FALSE
    ),
    yaxis = list(
      title = "",
      showgrid = FALSE,
      zeroline = FALSE,
      autorange = "reversed"  # Faz com que o primeiro nível (Python) apareça no topo
    ),
    paper_bgcolor = "black",
    plot_bgcolor  = "black",
    font = list(color = "white"),
    margin = list(l = 100, r = 50, t = 60, b = 60)
  ) %>%
  config(displayModeBar = FALSE)

fig_energy


```

## Running Code {style="font-size:14pt;"}

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

```{r}
#| warning: false
library(tidyverse)
library(palmerpenguins)
penguins |>                                      # <1>
  mutate(                                        # <2>
    bill_ratio = bill_depth_mm / bill_length_mm, # <2>
    bill_area  = bill_depth_mm * bill_length_mm  # <2>
  )                                              # <2>
```

1.  Take `penguins`, and then,
2.  add new columns for the bill ratio and bill area.
:::
